I’ll put this together for you Palac

#1: pulling daily stats
Priority: High
Example URL:
https://stats.nba.com/teams/advanced/?sort=TEAM_NAME&dir=-1&Season=2019-20&SeasonType=Regular%20Season&DateFrom=12%2F06%2F2019&DateTo=12%2F06%2F2019

This link we use for pulling team stats for one given day. So we set the date filter to be “to” and “from” the same date. We currently pull pace, but to futureproof ourselves, let’s say we need the table (which I assume isn’t any more difficult than pulling one column. If it is proving to be difficult, we can pick and choose what we need)


#2 pulling team stats
Priority: Med/High
URL:
https://stats.nba.com/teams/advanced/?sort=TEAM_NAME&dir=-1

We probably will need this whole table.


#3 pulling advanced team stats
Priority: low
URL example:
https://stats.nba.com/team/1610612737/advanced/

We’re pretty much interested in everything on this page. Only annoying thing is that each team has a unique page. 

NOTE: this one actually has the same stats as page #2 in the “overall” table, but each team has a unique page which is annoying. Just wanted to throw that out there. 


#4 player statistics
Priority: insanely low
URL examples:
https://stats.nba.com/team/1610612737/onoffcourt-advanced/
https://stats.nba.com/team/1610612737/onoffcourt-summary/
We will probably need everything on here. And I can’t stress enough how low of a priority these are.

Alright @Mr. Poopybutthole , so here's an equation you can play with.

This is all going to be the calculation of a statistic that we call "Game Pace Influence". Each team gets a number as a result of any individual game.

Let's say we're trying to calculate the game pace influence for a game on 2/21.

Now because we're backtesting, any team statistics should have the date range of 10/22 to 2/21. 10/22 is the first day of the season.

Here's a link to the team stats for that range:
https://stats.nba.com/teams/advanced/?sort=TEAM_NAME&dir=-1&Season=2019-20&SeasonType=Regular%20Season&DateFrom=10%2F22%2F2019&DateTo=02%2F21%2F2020

First off, you have to calculate something we call "Team Weighted Pace". It's a team statistic based on season averages.

Team Weighted Pace = (( [Team Season Pace] - [Average Pace of NBA] + (( [Team Season Pace] - [Average Pace of NBA] ) / 30 )) * 2 + [Average Pace of NBA]

Now with team weighted pace, you should be able to calculate the game pace influence result for any individual game.

Team A Game Pace Influence = (( [Average Team Weighted Pace of Team A and B] - [Actual Pace Result for Game] ) / ( [Average Team Weighted Pace of Team A and B] - [Team A Weighted Pace] )) * ( [Absolute Value of Difference between Team A Season Pace and Team B Season Pace] / [Average Margin of Pace in All NBA Games] )

Team A Game Pace Influence = (Team B Game Pace Influence) * -1

To find "Actual Pace" results for a game on 2/21, go to this link:
https://stats.nba.com/teams/advanced/?sort=TEAM_NAME&dir=-1&Season=2019-20&SeasonType=Regular%20Season&DateFrom=02%2F21%2F2020&DateTo=02%2F21%2F2020
It's the same as the team statistics page, but I just made the date range 1 game. The actual pace is going to be the same for both teams in any given game.

Also, for "Average Margin of Pace in All NBA Games", Matt and I will tell you what the number for that is later today, rather than making you calculate that for the whole season lol.

Also Don idk how he did it. But yeah we just had a quick call today, and he was just updating us on his progress. He's gonna start figuring out how to automate the process more and we're gonna put this on an AWS server. So he's getting a head start on that. And then he also wanted an equation to play around with, so I just gave him an equation to play around with above.
